Well, I personally feel that KSP2 is going on a more modern/futuristic take on Space Programs (Due to the new UI and graphic design I guess), but then we still have pods inspired by Apollo and Gemini, and in KSP1 we had the Making History expansion pack. This just makes me wonder though, can we re-implement the Soviet space program parts again in KSP2?

 

The need for soviet parts suddenly came up to me as I was building transport vehicles for my space station. Back when I had Making History in KSP1, I'm obsessed with using a replica Soyuz as the designated vehicle, and more to that, Soyuz rocket EXCLUSIVELY for the transportation to the space station . I did try messing around and make Soyuz-like rockets in KSP2, but I can never get a function-heavy booster for the lauch stage, and now I really crave those Soviet enspired parts to be part of KSP2 again. 

 

Also, talking about replicating Heavy Launch Vehicles, I'm also entrigued about the idea of creating Proton series, Energia and N1 in KSP2 as heavy lauch vehicles, since these *brutalist solution* to heavy payloads seems quite fitting for the KSP setting, RAMPING UP THE SIZE way of solution.
I think they may have said that implementing a whole new part diameter would take too much time away from milestones, so they would consider this after 1.0.
